Types of events   UIC Career Services conducts a variety of programs and events  to empower career development:   Host advising sessions via pop-up events and at the UIC Career Services office to help students with quick questions on their resumes/CVs, cover letters, or other related career questions.  Host and lead workshops addressing a range of topics including  career exploration, resume/CV writing, salary negotiation, and networking.  Sponsor Career, job, and internship fairs for current students and alumni throughout the academic year.  These fairs provide an opportunity for UIC students and alumni to network with perspective employers and/or recruiters, learn about job opportunities, and in some instances, submit their resumes.  UIC Careers Services and the Student Employment Office (SEO) work with recruiting employers to set up information sessions, information booths, and sponsor networking events .         What typically happens at a career/job fair?         Career Fair explanation   Fairs provide opportunities for students/alumni to learn about potential careers in industry sectors, network with perspective employers, and often submit resumes to prospective employers for full- and part-time jobs and/or internships.  (Note:  Some employers may require online submission of resumes and/or employment applications).  Hear and see what happens at UIC career/job fairs:         What are the career/job fairs held at UIC?         Career Fair descriptions   Career Fairs provide opportunities for students/alumni to learn about potential careers in industry sectors, network with perspective employers, and often submit resumes to prospective employers  Visit the link below to learn more about the fairs that UIC hosts and participates in throughout the academic year.    UIC Career/Job Fair Descriptions          Who can attend UIC career/job fairs?         Career Fair Attendees   Unless otherwise noted, only UIC students and alumni are eligible to attend the fairs*.  *Proof of UIC affiliation is required; some examples include i-card, alumni association card, miniature diploma, or unofficial transcript showing current classes or degree conferred.        What advice and tips are available for attending a career/job fair?         Career fair tips     Review our tips and eLearning on how to connect successfully with employers at Career Fairs including tips on what to do before, during, and after attending a fair; what to wear at a fair; and researching employers.               Career Fair Tips          What career workshops are offered?         What are the workshops offered by Career Services?   Career Services’ career workshops provide educational opportunities for students to learn about key career readiness skills and topics.  Workshops are delivered by Career Services staff members.  Workshops span a gamut of topics including resume tips, navigating a career fair, and exploring majors to name a few.      Career Services Workshop Descriptions    Upcoming Career Services Workshops          How do I request a Career Workshop or  Class Visit?         workshop request   UIC staff, faculty, and student organizations: Request a career presentation or class visit by launching the form linked below.  Workshops are scheduled on a first come, first serve basis.  Please allow two weeks advance notice when selecting your program date.  Non-UIC requesters: Please do not complete the form.  Please contact Career Services at (312) 996-2300.
